title: The Power of Diversity (Tighty Whities Experiment) 1/3

tasks.task: Dr. Mike Lehman's talk about an underwear experiment and a field crop rotation experiment
subtasks: Backtracking before explaining the underwear experiment
Describing the 16-year-old field experiment with rotational crops
Presenting the field view showing different rotation plots: two-year corn and soybean vs. four-year rotation with other crops
Highlighting the focus on diversity in crops, residues, root exodus, and architecture
Presenting findings on reduced nitrous oxide loss (25%) in four-year rotations
Discussing increased soil organic matter (25%) in four-year rotations compared to two-year
Mentioning no-till practice in all plots with cropping system treatments
Presenting higher soybean yields (25%) in the four-year rotation system
Introducing the visual demonstration of soil decomposition speed
